page.title: 17HOUSING CONSERVATION
page.content: 1Many houses built in South Moor about 100 years ago by the{National Coal {Board}for miners,are in a poor state of repair and lack basic amenities that newer houses have.Now there are no coal mines working here so a non-profit making housing association, "The Three Rivers",is to work with {Derwentside District Council}in a conservation and revitalisation programme to improve the houses instead of pulling them down, as has happened in other communities.They plan to spend about Â£13500 on each of 150 houses over the next 5 years, to make them more attractive and comfortable to live in.They plan to rent them at reasonable rates;about Â£16 per week,to people on low incomes. This will be helpful in an area of very high unemployment.
